summary: This bill, the "Restoring Judicial Separation of Powers Act," aims to reform the U.S. Supreme Court and federal court system. Key changes include the creation of a multi-circuit panel within the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals, alterations to direct appeals procedures, and limitations on nationwide injunctions. It also addresses the timing of appeals and requires written explanations for court decisions under certain circumstances. The bill focuses on shifting jurisdiction and restructuring how cases are reviewed, and when these changes will take effect.
